   20: -module(zip_SUITE).
   21: 
   22: -export([all/0, suite/0,groups/0,init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1, 
   23: 	 init_per_group/2,end_per_group/2,
   24:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2]).
   25: 
   26: -export([borderline/1, atomic/1,
   27:          bad_zip/1, unzip_from_binary/1, unzip_to_binary/1,
   28:          zip_to_binary/1,
   29:          unzip_options/1, zip_options/1, list_dir_options/1, aliases/1,
   30:          zip_api/1, open_leak/1, unzip_jar/1,
   31: 	 unzip_traversal_exploit/1,
   32:          compress_control/1,
   33: 	 foldl/1,fd_leak/1,unicode/1,test_zip_dir/1,
   34:          explicit_file_info/1, mode/1,
   35:          zip64_central_headers/1, unzip64_central_headers/1,
   36:          zip64_central_directory/1,
   37:          basic_timestamp/1, extended_timestamp/1,
   38:          uid_gid/1]).
   39: 
   40: -import(proplists,[get_value/2, get_value/3]).
   41: 
   42: -include_lib("kernel/include/file.hrl").
   43: -include_lib("stdlib/include/zip.hrl").
   44: -include_lib("stdlib/include/assert.hrl").
   45: 
   46: suite() -> [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]}].
   47: 
   48: all() -> 
   49:     [borderline, atomic, bad_zip, unzip_from_binary,
   50:      unzip_to_binary, zip_to_binary, unzip_options,
   51:      zip_options, list_dir_options, aliases,
   52:      zip_api, open_leak, unzip_jar, compress_control, foldl,
   53:      unzip_traversal_exploit, fd_leak, unicode, test_zip_dir,
   54:      explicit_file_info, {group, zip_group}, {group, zip64_group}].
   55: 
   56: groups() -> 
   57:     zip_groups().
   58: 
   59: %% zip   - Use zip unix tools
   60: %% ezip  - Use erlang zip on disk
   61: %% emzip - Use erlang zip in memory
   62: -define(ZIP_MODES,[zip, ezip, emzip]).
   63: -define(UNZIP_MODES,[unzip, unezip, unemzip]).
   64: 
   65: zip_groups() ->
   66: 
   67:     ZipGroup=
   68:         [{zip_group,[],[{group,ZipMode} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   69:         [{ZipMode, [], [{group,UnZipMode} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   70:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   71:         [{G, [parallel], zip_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   72: 
   73:     Zip64Group = [{zip64_group,[],[{group,z64(ZipMode)} || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES]}] ++
   74:         [{z64(ZipMode), [sequence], [zip64_central_headers]++
   75:               [{group,z64(UnZipMode)} || UnZipMode <- ?UNZIP_MODES]}
   76:          || ZipMode <- ?ZIP_MODES] ++
   77:         [{z64(G), [], zip64_testcases()} || G <- ?UNZIP_MODES],
   78: 
   79:     ZipGroup ++ Zip64Group.
   80: 
   81: z64(Mode) when is_atom(Mode) ->
   82:     list_to_atom(lists:concat([z64_,Mode]));
   83: z64(Modes) when is_list(Modes) ->
   84:     [z64(M) || M <- Modes].
   85: 
   86: noz64(Z64Mode) ->
   87:     case string:split(atom_to_list(Z64Mode), "_") of
   88:         ["z64",Mode] ->
   89:             list_to_atom(Mode);
   90:         [_Mode] ->
   91:             Z64Mode
   92:     end.
   93: 
   94: zip_testcases() ->
   95:     [mode, basic_timestamp, extended_timestamp, uid_gid].
   96: 
   97: zip64_testcases() ->
   98:     [unzip64_central_headers,
   99:      zip64_central_directory].
  100: 
  101: init_per_suite(Config) ->
  102:     {ok, Started} = application:ensure_all_started(os_mon),
  103:     [{started, Started} | Config].
  104: 
  105: end_per_suite(Config) ->
  106:     [application:stop(App) || App <- lists:reverse(get_value(started, Config))],
  107:     ok.
  108: 
  109: init_per_group(zip64_group, Config) ->
  110:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  111: 
  112:     case disc_free(PrivDir) of
  113:         error ->
  114:             {skip, "Failed to query disk space for priv_dir. "
  115:              "Is it on a remote file system?~n"};
  116:         N when N >= 16 * (1 bsl 20) ->
  117:             ct:pal("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  118:             OneMB = <<0:(8 bsl 20)>>,
  119:             Large4GB = filename:join(PrivDir, "large.txt"),
  120:             ok = file:write_file(Large4GB, lists:duplicate(4 bsl 10, OneMB)),
  121:             Medium4MB = filename:join(PrivDir, "medium.txt"),
  122:             ok = file:write_file(Medium4MB, lists:duplicate(4, OneMB)),
  123: 
  124:             [{large, Large4GB},{medium,Medium4MB}|Config];
  125:         N when N < 16 * (1 bsl 20) ->
  126:             ct:pal("Free disk: ~w KByte~n", [N]),
  127:             {skip,"Less than 16 GByte free"}
  128:     end;
  129: init_per_group(Group, Config) ->
  130:     case lists:member(Group, ?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES ++ z64(?ZIP_MODES ++ ?UNZIP_MODES)) of
  131:         true ->
  132:             case get_value(zip, Config) of
  133:                 undefined ->
  134:                     Pdir = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),Group),
  135:                     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  136:                     [{pdir, Pdir},{zip, noz64(Group)} | Config];
  137:                 _Zip ->
  138:                     Pdir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config),Group),
  139:                     ok = filelib:ensure_path(Pdir),
  140:                     [{pdir, Pdir},{unzip, noz64(Group)} | Config]
  141:             end;
  142:         false ->
  143:             Config
  144:     end.
  145: 
  146: end_per_group(_GroupName, Config) ->
  147:     file:del_dir_r(get_value(pdir,Config)),
  148:     Config.
  149: 
  150: init_per_testcase(TC, Config) ->
  151:     UsesZip = get_value(zip, Config) =:= zip orelse get_value(unzip, Config) =:= unzip,
  152:     HasZip = has_zip(),
  153:     UsesEMZip = get_value(zip, Config) =:= emzip orelse get_value(unzip, Config) =:= unemzip,
  154:     Memsize = memsize(),
  155:     if UsesZip andalso not HasZip ->
  156:             {skip, "No zip command found"};
  157:        UsesEMZip andalso Memsize < 8 bsl 30 ->
  158:             {skip, "Testing emzip needs more that 8 GB of memory"};
  159:        true ->
  160:             PrivDir = filename:join(get_value(pdir, Config,get_value(priv_dir, Config)), TC),
  161:             ok = filelib:ensure_path(PrivDir),
  162:             [{pdir, PrivDir} | Config]
  163:     end.
  164: 
  165: 
  166: end_per_testcase(_TC, Config) ->
  167:     file:del_dir_r(get_value(pdir,Config)),
  168:     Config.
  169: 
  170: %% Test creating, listing and extracting one file from an archive
  171: %% multiple times with different file sizes. Also check that the
  172: %% modification date of the extracted file has survived.
  173: borderline(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  174:     RootDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  175:     TempDir = filename:join(RootDir, "borderline"),
  176: 
  177:     Record = 512,
  178:     Block = 20 * Record,
  179: 
  180:     lists:foreach(fun(Size) -> borderline_test(Size, TempDir) end,
  181:                   [0, 1, 10, 13, 127, 333, Record-1, Record, Record+1,
  182:                    Block-Record-1, Block-Record, Block-Record+1,
  183:                    Block-1, Block, Block+1,
  184:                    Block+Record-1, Block+Record, Block+Record+1]),
  185: 
  186:     %% Clean up.
  187:     delete_files([TempDir]),
  188:     ok.
  189: 
  190: borderline_test(Size, TempDir) ->
  191:     Archive = filename:join(TempDir, "ar_"++integer_to_list(Size)++".zip"),
  192:     Name = filename:join(TempDir, "file_"++integer_to_list(Size)),
  193:     io:format("Testing size ~p", [Size]),
  194: 
  195:     %% Create a file and archive it.
  196:     {_, _, X0} = erlang:timestamp(),
  197:     file:write_file(Name, random_byte_list(X0, Size)),
  198:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [Name]),
  199:     ok = file:delete(Name),
  200: 
  201:     %% Verify listing and extracting.
  202:     {ok, [#zip_comment{comment = []},
  203:           #zip_file{name = Name,
  204:                     info = Info,
  205:                     offset = 0,
  206:                     comp_size = _}]} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
  207:     Size = Info#file_info.size,
  208:     {ok, [Name]} = zip:extract(Archive, [verbose]),
  209: 
  210:     %% Verify contents of extracted file.
  211:     {ok, Bin} = file:read_file(Name),
  212:     true = match_byte_list(X0, binary_to_list(Bin)),
  213: 
  214: 
  215:     %% Verify that Unix zip can read it. (if we have a unix zip that is!)
  216:     zipinfo_match(Archive, Name),
  217: 
  218:     ok.
  219: 
  220: zipinfo_match(Archive, Name) ->
  221:     case check_zipinfo_exists() of
  222:         true ->
  223:             Encoding = file:native_name_encoding(),
  224:             Expect = unicode:characters_to_binary(Name ++ "\n",
  225:                                                   Encoding, Encoding),
  226:             cmd_expect("zipinfo -1 " ++ Archive, Expect);
  227:         _ ->
  228:             ok
  229:     end.
  230: 
  231: check_zipinfo_exists() ->
  232:     is_list(os:find_executable("zipinfo")).
  233: 
  234: cmd_expect(Cmd, Expect) ->
  235:     Port = open_port({spawn, make_cmd(Cmd)}, [stream, in, binary, eof]),
  236:     get_data(Port, Expect, <<>>).
  237: 
  238: get_data(Port, Expect, Acc) ->
  239:     receive
  240:         {Port, {data, Bytes}} ->
  241:             get_data(Port, Expect, <<Acc/binary, Bytes/binary>>);
  242:         {Port, eof} ->
  243:             Port ! {self(), close},
  244:             receive
  245:                 {Port, closed} ->
  246:                     true
  247:             end,
  248:             receive
  249:                 {'EXIT',  Port,  _} ->
  250:                     ok
  251:             after 1 ->                          % force context switch
  252:                     ok
  253:             end,
  254:             match_output(Acc, Expect, Port)
  255:     end.
  256: 
  257: match_output(<<C, Output/bits>>, <<C,Expect/bits>>, Port) ->
  258:     match_output(Output, Expect, Port);
  259: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>, <<_, _/bits>>, Port) ->
  260:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, badmatch);
  261: match_output(<<_, _/bits>>=Rest, <<>>, Port) ->
  262:     kill_port_and_fail(Port, {too_much_data, Rest});
  263: match_output(<<>>, <<>>, _Port) ->
  264:     ok.
  265: 
  266: kill_port_and_fail(Port, Reason) ->
  267:     unlink(Port),
  268:     exit(Port, die),
  269:     ct:fail(Reason).
  270: 
  271: make_cmd(Cmd) ->
  272:     Cmd.
  273: %%     case os:type() of
  274: %%      {win32, _} -> lists:concat(["cmd /c",  Cmd]);
  275: %%      {unix, _}  -> lists:concat(["sh -c '",  Cmd,  "'"])
  276: %%     end.
  277: 
  278: %% Verifies a random byte list.
  279: 
  280: match_byte_list(X0, [Byte|Rest]) ->
  281:     X = next_random(X0),
  282:     case (X bsr 26) band 16#ff of
  283:         Byte -> match_byte_list(X, Rest);
  284:         _ -> false
  285:     end;
  286: match_byte_list(_, []) ->
  287:     true.
  288: 
  289: %% Generates a random byte list.
  290: 
  291: random_byte_list(X0, Count) ->
  292:     random_byte_list(X0, Count, []).
  293: 
  294: random_byte_list(X0, Count, Result) when Count > 0->
  295:     X = next_random(X0),
  296:     random_byte_list(X, Count-1, [(X bsr 26) band 16#ff|Result]);
  297: random_byte_list(_X, 0, Result) ->
  298:     lists:reverse(Result).
  299: 
  300: %% This RNG is from line 21 on page 102 in Knuth: The Art of Computer Programming,
  301: %% Volume II, Seminumerical Algorithms.
  302: 
  303: next_random(X) ->
  304:     (X*17059465+1) band 16#fffffffff.
  305: 
  306: %% Test the 'atomic' operations: zip/unzip/list_dir, on archives.
  307: %% Also test the 'cooked' option.
  308: atomic(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  309:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  310:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  311:     Names = [Name || {Name,_,_} <- DataFiles],
  312:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  313: 
  314:     %% Create a zip  archive.
  315: 
  316:     Zip2 = "zip.zip",
  317:     {ok, Zip2} = zip:zip(Zip2, Names, []),
  318:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip2)),
  319: 
  320:     %% Same test again, but this time created with 'cooked'
  321: 
  322:     Zip3 = "cooked.zip",
  323:     {ok, Zip3} = zip:zip(Zip3, Names, [cooked]),
  324:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3)),
  325:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:list_dir(Zip3, [cooked])),
  326: 
  327:     %% Clean up.
  328:     delete_files([Zip2,Zip3|Names]),
  329: 
  330:     ok.
  331: 
  332: %% Test the zip_open/2, zip_get/1, zip_get/2, zip_close/1,
  333: %% and zip_list_dir/1 functions.
  334: zip_api(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  335:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  336:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  337:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  338:     io:format("Names: ~p", [Names]),
  339: 
  340:     %% Create a zip archive
  341:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  342:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, Names, []),
  343: 
  344:     %% Open archive
  345:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  346: 
  347:     %% List dir
  348:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  349: 
  350:     %% Get a file
  351:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  352:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(Name1),
  353:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  354:     Data1Crc = erlang:crc32(Data1),
  355:     {ok, Data1Crc} = zip:zip_get_crc32(Name1, ZipSrv),
  356: 
  357:     %% Get all files
  358:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(Name),
  359:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  360:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  361: 
  362:     %% Close
  363:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  364: 
  365:     %% Clean up.
  366:     delete_files([Names]),
  367: 
  368:     ok.
  369: 
  370: %% Test that zip doesn't leak processes and ports where the
  371: %% controlling process dies without closing an zip opened with
  372: %% zip:zip_open/1.
  373: open_leak(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  374:     %% Create a zip archive
  375:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  376:     {ok, Zip} = zip:zip(Zip, [], []),
  377: 
  378:     %% Open archive in a another process that dies immediately.
  379:     ZipSrv = spawn_zip(Zip, [memory]),
  380: 
  381:     %% Expect the ZipSrv process to die soon after.
  382:     true = spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv),
  383: 
  384:     %% Clean up.
  385:     delete_files([Zip]),
  386: 
  387:     ok.
  388: 
  389: spawn_zip(Zip, Options) ->
  390:     Self = self(),
  391:     spawn(fun() -> Self ! zip:zip_open(Zip, Options) end),
  392:     receive
  393:         {ok, ZipSrv} ->
  394:             ZipSrv
  395:     end.
  396: 
  397: spawned_zip_dead(ZipSrv) ->
  398:     Ref = monitor(process, ZipSrv),
  399:     receive
  400:         {'DOWN', Ref, _, ZipSrv, _} ->
  401:             true
  402:     after 1000 ->
  403:             false
  404:     end.
  405: 
  406: %% Test options for unzip, only cwd and file_list currently.
  407: unzip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  408:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  409:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  410:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  411: 
  412:     %% create a temp directory
  413:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "t"),
  414:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  415: 
  416:     FList = ["quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt"],
  417: 
  418:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  419:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},
  420: 				     {file_list, FList}]),
  421: 
  422:     %% Verify.
  423:     true = (length(FList) =:= length(RetList)),
  424:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  425: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  426: 		  FList),
  427:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  428: 		  RetList),
  429: 
  430:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  431:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  432: 
  433:     FList2 = ["abc.txt","quotes/rain.txt","wikipedia.txt","emptyFile"],
  434: 
  435:     %% Unzip a zip file in Subdir
  436:     {ok, RetList2} = zip:unzip(Long, [{cwd, Subdir},skip_directories]),
  437: 
  438:     %% Verify.
  439:     true = (length(RetList2) =:= 4),
  440:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  441: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  442: 		  FList2),
  443:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> ok = file:delete(F) end,
  444: 		  RetList2),
  445: 
  446:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  447:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  448:     ok.
  449: 
  450: %% Test that unzip handles directory traversal exploit (OTP-13633)
  451: unzip_traversal_exploit(Config) ->
  452:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  453:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  454:     ZipName = filename:join(DataDir, "exploit.zip"),
  455: 
  456:     %% $ zipinfo -1 test/zip_SUITE_data/exploit.zip 
  457:     %% clash.txt
  458:     %% ../clash.txt
  459:     %% ../above.txt
  460:     %% subdir/../in_root_dir.txt
  461: 
  462:     %% create a temp directory
  463:     SubDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "exploit_test"),
  464:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  465:     
  466:     ClashFile = filename:join(SubDir,"clash.txt"),
  467:     AboveFile = filename:join(SubDir,"above.txt"),
  468:     RelativePathFile = filename:join(SubDir,"subdir/../in_root_dir.txt"),
  469: 
  470:     %% unzip in SubDir
  471:     {ok, [ClashFile, ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  472: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir}]),
  473: 
  474:     {ok,<<"This file will overwrite other file.\n">>} =
  475: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  476:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(AboveFile),
  477:     {ok,_} = file:read_file(RelativePathFile),
  478: 
  479:     %% clean up
  480:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  481:     
  482:      %% create the temp directory again
  483:     ok = file:make_dir(SubDir),
  484: 
  485:     %% unzip in SubDir
  486:     {ok, [ClashFile, AboveFile, RelativePathFile]} =
  487: 	zip:unzip(ZipName, [{cwd,SubDir},keep_old_files]),
  488: 
  489:     {ok,<<"This is the original file.\n">>} =
  490: 	file:read_file(ClashFile),
  491:    
  492:     %% clean up
  493:     delete_files([SubDir]),
  494:     ok.
  495: 
  496: %% Test unzip a jar file (OTP-7382).
  497: unzip_jar(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  498:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  499:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  500:     JarFile = filename:join(DataDir, "test.jar"),
  501: 
  502:     %% create a temp directory
  503:     Subdir = filename:join(PrivDir, "jartest"),
  504:     ok = file:make_dir(Subdir),
  505: 
  506:     FList = ["META-INF/MANIFEST.MF","test.txt"],
  507: 
  508:     {ok, RetList} = zip:unzip(JarFile, [{cwd, Subdir}]),
  509: 
  510:     %% Verify.
  511:     lists:foreach(fun(F)-> {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F)),
  512: 			   {ok,B} = file:read_file(filename:join(Subdir, F)) end,
  513: 		  FList),
  514:     lists:foreach(fun(F)->
  515:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  516:                               true -> ok = file:del_dir(F);
  517:                               false -> ok = file:delete(F)
  518:                           end
  519:                   end,
  520: 		  lists:reverse(RetList)),
  521: 
  522:     %% Clean up and verify no more files.
  523:     0 = delete_files([Subdir]),
  524:     ok.
  525: 
  526: %% Test the options for unzip, only cwd currently.
  527: zip_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  528:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  529:     ok = file:set_cwd(PrivDir),
  530:     DataFiles = data_files(),
  531:     Names = [Name || {Name, _, _} <- DataFiles],
  532: 
  533:     %% Make sure cwd is not where we get the files
  534:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(data_dir, Config)),
  535: 
  536:     %% Create a zip archive
  537:     {ok, {_,Zip}} =
  538:         zip:zip("filename_not_used.zip", Names, [memory, {cwd, PrivDir}]),
  539: 
  540:     %% Open archive
  541:     {ok, ZipSrv} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  542: 
  543:     %% List dir
  544:     Names = names_from_list_dir(zip:zip_list_dir(ZipSrv)),
  545: 
  546:     %% Get a file
  547:     Name1 = hd(Names),
  548:     {ok, Data1} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name1)),
  549:     {ok, {Name1, Data1}} = zip:zip_get(Name1, ZipSrv),
  550: 
  551:     %% Get all files
  552:     FilesDatas = lists:map(fun(Name) -> {ok, B} = file:read_file(filename:join(PrivDir, Name)),
  553:                                         {Name, B} end, Names),
  554:     {ok, FilesDatas} = zip:zip_get(ZipSrv),
  555: 
  556:     %% Close
  557:     ok = zip:zip_close(ZipSrv),
  558: 
  559:     %% Clean up.
  560:     delete_files([Names]),
  561: 
  562:     ok.
  563: 
  564: %% Test the options for list_dir... one day.
  565: list_dir_options(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  566: 
  567:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  568:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  569: 
  570:     {ok,
  571:      ["abc.txt", "quotes/rain.txt", "empty/", "wikipedia.txt", "emptyFile" ]} =
  572:         zip:list_dir(Archive,[names_only]),
  573: 
  574:     {ok,
  575:      [#zip_comment{},
  576:       #zip_file{ name = "abc.txt" },
  577:       #zip_file{ name = "quotes/rain.txt" },
  578:       #zip_file{ name = "wikipedia.txt" },
  579:       #zip_file{ name = "emptyFile" }
  580:      ]} =  zip:list_dir(Archive,[skip_directories]),
  581: 
  582:     ok.
  583: 
  584: %% convert zip_info as returned from list_dir to a list of names
  585: names_from_list_dir({ok, Info}) ->
  586:     names_from_list_dir(Info);
  587: names_from_list_dir(Info) ->
  588:     tl(lists:map(fun(#zip_file{name = Name}) -> Name;
  589:                     (_) -> ok end, Info)).
  590: 
  591: %% Returns a sequence of characters.
  592: char_seq(N, First) ->
  593:     char_seq(N, First, []).
  594: 
  595: char_seq(0, _, Result) ->
  596:     Result;
  597: char_seq(N, C, Result) when C < 127 ->
  598:     char_seq(N-1, C+1, [C|Result]);
  599: char_seq(N, _, Result) ->
  600:     char_seq(N, $!, Result).
  601: 
  602: data_files() ->
  603:     Files = [{"first_file", 1555, $a},
  604:              {"small_file", 7, $d},
  605:              {"big_file", 23875, $e},
  606:              {"last_file", 7500, $g}],
  607:     create_files(Files),
  608:     Files.
  609: 
  610: create_files([{Name, dir, _First}|Rest]) ->
  611:     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  612:     create_files(Rest);
  613: create_files([{Name, Size, First}|Rest]) when is_integer(Size) ->
  614:     ok = file:write_file(Name, char_seq(Size, First)),
  615:     create_files(Rest);
  616: create_files([]) ->
  617:     ok.
  618:

  623: %%     Name = filename:join(Parent, Dir),
  624: %%     ok = file:make_dir(Name),
  625: %%     make_dirs(Rest, Name);
  626: %% make_dirs([], Dir) ->
  627: %%     Dir.

  629: %% Try zip:unzip/1 on some corrupted zip files.
  630: bad_zip(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  631:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  632:     try_bad("bad_crc",    {bad_crc, "abc.txt"}, Config),
  633:     try_bad("bad_central_directory", bad_central_directory, Config),
  634:     try_bad("bad_file_header",    bad_file_header, Config),
  635:     try_bad("bad_eocd",    bad_eocd, Config),
  636:     try_bad("enoent", enoent, Config),
  637:     GetNotFound = fun(A) ->
  638:                           {ok, O} = zip:zip_open(A, []),
  639:                           zip:zip_get("not_here", O)
  640:                   end,
  641:     try_bad("abc", file_not_found, GetNotFound, Config),
  642:     ok.
  643: 
  644: try_bad(N, R, Config) ->
  645:     try_bad(N, R, fun(A) -> io:format("name : ~p\n", [A]),
  646:                             zip:unzip(A, [verbose]) end, Config).
  647: 
  648: try_bad(Name0, Reason, What, Config) ->
  649:     %% Intentionally no macros here.
  650: 
  651:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  652:     Name = Name0 ++ ".zip",
  653:     io:format("~nTrying ~s", [Name]),
  654:     Full = filename:join(DataDir, Name),
  655:     Expected = {error, Reason},
  656:     case What(Full) of
  657:         Expected ->
  658:             io:format("Result: ~p\n", [Expected]);
  659:         Other ->
  660:             io:format("unzip/2 returned ~p (expected ~p)\n", [Other, Expected]),
  661:             ct:fail({bad_return_value, Other})
  662:     end.
  663: 
  664: %% Test extracting to binary with memory option.
  665: unzip_to_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  666:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  667:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  668:     WorkDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "unzip_to_binary"),
  669:     _ = file:make_dir(WorkDir),
  670:     _ = file:make_dir(filename:join(DataDir, "empty")),
  671: 
  672:     ok = file:set_cwd(WorkDir),
  673:     Long = filename:join(DataDir, "abc.zip"),
  674: 
  675:     %% Unzip a zip file into a binary
  676:     {ok, FBList} = zip:unzip(Long, [memory]),
  677: 
  678:     %% Verify.
  679:     lists:foreach(fun({F,B}) ->
  680:                           Filename = filename:join(DataDir, F),
  681:                           case lists:last(F) =:= $/ of
  682:                               true ->
  683:                                   <<>> = B,
  684:                                   {ok, #file_info{ type = directory}} =
  685:                                       file:read_file_info(Filename);
  686:                               false ->
  687:                                   {ok,B}=file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, F))
  688:                           end
  689:                   end, FBList),
  690: 
  691:     %% Make sure no files created in cwd
  692:     {ok,[]} = file:list_dir(WorkDir),
  693: 
  694:     ok.
  695:

  749: %% Test extracting a zip archive from a binary.
  750: unzip_from_binary(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  751:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
  752:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  753:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract_from_binary"),

  772:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),

  775:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  776:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  777: 
  778:     %% Clean up.
  779:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, Archive, ExtractDir]),
  780: 
  781:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
  782:     file:set_cwd(ExtractDir),
  783: 
  784:     %% Read a zip file into a binary and extract from the binary with skip_directories
  785:     {ok, [FileName,Quote,Wikipedia,EmptyFile]}
  786:         = zip:unzip(Bin, [skip_directories]),
  787: 
  788:     %% Verify.

  791:     {ok, Data} = file:read_file(DestFilename),
  792: 
  793:     DestQuote = filename:join([ExtractDir, "quotes", "rain.txt"]),
  794:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(filename:join(DataDir, Quote)),
  795:     {ok, QuoteData} = file:read_file(DestQuote),
  796: 
  797:     %% Clean up.
  798:     delete_files([DestFilename, DestQuote, ExtractDir]),
  799:

  802: %% oac_files() ->
  803: %%     Files = [{"oac_file", 1459, $x},
  804: %%           {"oac_small", 99, $w},
  805: %%           {"oac_big", 33896, $A}],

  809: %% Delete the given list of files and directories.
  810: %% Return total number of deleted files (not directories)
  811: delete_files(List) ->
  812:     do_delete_files(List, 0).
  813: do_delete_files([],Cnt) ->
  814:     Cnt;
  815: do_delete_files([Item|Rest], Cnt) ->
  816:     case file:delete(Item) of
  817:         ok ->
  818:             DelCnt = 1;
  819:         {error,eperm} ->
  820:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  821:             DelCnt = delete_files(filelib:wildcard(filename:join(Item, "*"))),
  822:             file:del_dir(Item);
  823:         {error,eacces} ->
  824:             %% We'll see about that!
  825:             file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  826:             case file:delete(Item) of
  827:                 ok ->
  828: 		    DelCnt = 1;
  829:                 {error,_} ->
  830:                     erlang:yield(),
  831:                     file:change_mode(Item, 8#777),
  832:                     file:delete(Item),
  833:                     DelCnt = 1
  834:             end;
  835:         {error,_} ->
  836:             DelCnt = 0
  837:     end,
  838:     do_delete_files(Rest, Cnt + DelCnt).
  839: 
  840: %% Test control of which files that should be compressed.
  841: compress_control(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  842:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
  843:     Dir = "compress_control",
  844:     Files = [
  845:              {Dir,                                                          dir,   $d},
  846:              {filename:join([Dir, "first_file.txt"]), 10000, $f},
  847:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  848:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "zzz.zip"]), 10000, $z},
  849:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "lll.lzh"]), 10000, $l},
  850:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "eee.exe"]), 10000, $e},
  851:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $g},
  852:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir"]), dir,   $d},
  853:              {filename:join([Dir, "a_dir", "b_dir", "ggg.arj"]), 10000, $a},
  854:              {filename:join([Dir, "last_file.txt"]), 10000, $l}
  855:             ],
  856: 
  857:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  858: 			  Files,
  859: 			  [{compress, []}],
  860: 			  []),
  861: 
  862:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  863: 			  Files,
  864: 			  [{uncompress, all}],
  865: 			  []),
  866: 
  867:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  868: 			  Files,
  869: 			  [{uncompress, []}],
  870: 			  [".txt", ".exe", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  871: 
  872:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  873: 			  Files,
  874: 			  [],
  875: 			  [".txt", ".exe"]),
  876: 
  877:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  878: 			  Files,
  879: 			  [{uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  880: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  881: 			  [".txt", ".zip", "arj"]),
  882: 
  883:     test_compress_control(Dir,
  884: 			  Files,
  885: 			  [{uncompress, []},
  886: 			   {uncompress, {add, [".exe"]}},
  887: 			   {uncompress, {del, [".zip", "arj"]}}],
  888: 			  [".txt", ".zip", ".lzh", ".arj"]),
  889: 
  890:     ok.
  891: 
  892: test_compress_control(Dir, Files, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  893:     %% Cleanup
  894:     Zip = "zip.zip",
  895:     Names = [N || {N, _, _} <- Files],
  896:     delete_files([Zip]),
  897:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)),
  898: 
  899:     create_files(Files),
  900:     {ok, Zip} = zip:create(Zip, [Dir], ZipOptions),
  901: 
  902:     {ok, OpenZip} = zip:zip_open(Zip, [memory]),
  903:     {ok,[#zip_comment{comment = ""} | ZipList]} = zip:zip_list_dir(OpenZip),
  904:     io:format("compress_control:  -> ~p  -> ~p\n  -> ~pn", [Expected, ZipOptions, ZipList]),
  905:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected),
  906:     ok = zip:zip_close(OpenZip),
  907: 
  908:     %% Cleanup
  909:     delete_files([Zip]),
  910:     delete_files(lists:reverse(Names)), % Remove plain files before directories
  911: 
  912:     ok.
  913: 
  914: verify_compression([{Name, Kind, _Filler} | Files], ZipList, OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected) ->
  915:     {Name2, BinSz} =
  916:         case Kind of
  917:             dir ->
  918:                 {Name ++ "/", 0};
  919:             _   ->
  920:                 {ok, {Name, Bin}} = zip:zip_get(Name, OpenZip),
  921:                 {Name, size(Bin)}
  922:         end,
  923:     {Name2, {value, ZipFile}} = {Name2, lists:keysearch(Name2,  #zip_file.name, ZipList)},
  924:     #zip_file{info = #file_info{size = InfoSz, type = InfoType}, comp_size = InfoCompSz} = ZipFile,
  925: 
  926:     Ext = filename:extension(Name),
  927:     IsComp = is_compressed(Ext, Kind, ZipOptions),
  928:     ExpComp = lists:member(Ext, Expected),
  929:     case {Name, Kind, InfoType, IsComp, ExpComp, BinSz, InfoSz, InfoCompSz} of
  930:         {_, dir, directory, false, _,     Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  931:         {_, Sz,  regular,   false, false, Sz, Sz, Sz}      when Sz =:= BinSz -> ok;
  932:         {_, Sz,  regular,   true,  true,  Sz, Sz, OtherSz} when Sz =:= BinSz, OtherSz =/= BinSz -> ok
  933:     end,
  934:     verify_compression(Files, ZipList -- [ZipFile], OpenZip, ZipOptions, Expected);
  935: verify_compression([], [], _OpenZip, _ZipOptions, _Expected) ->
  936:     ok.
  937: 
  938: is_compressed(_Ext, dir, _Options) ->
  939:     false;
  940: is_compressed(Ext, _Sz, Options) ->
  941:     CompressOpt =
  942:         case [What || {compress, What} <- Options] of
  943:             [] -> all;
  944:             CompressOpts-> extensions(CompressOpts, all)
  945:         end,
  946:     DoCompress = (CompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, CompressOpt),
  947:     Default = [".Z", ".zip", ".zoo", ".arc", ".lzh", ".arj"],
  948:     UncompressOpt =
  949:         case [What || {uncompress, What} <- Options] of
  950:             [] -> Default;
  951:             UncompressOpts-> extensions(UncompressOpts, Default)
  952:         end,
  953:     DoUncompress = (UncompressOpt =:= all) orelse lists:member(Ext, UncompressOpt),
  954:     DoCompress andalso not DoUncompress.
  955: 
  956: extensions([H | T], Old) ->
  957:     case H of
  958:         all ->
  959:             extensions(T, H);
  960:         H when is_list(H) ->
  961:             extensions(T, H);
  962:         {add, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  963:             extensions(T, Old ++ New);
  964:         {del, New} when is_list(New), is_list(Old) ->
  965:             extensions(T, Old -- New);
  966:         _ ->
  967:             extensions(T, Old)
  968:     end;
  969: extensions([], Old) ->
  970:     Old.
  971: 
  972: foldl(Config) ->
  973:     PrivDir = get_value(priv_dir, Config),
  974:     File = filename:join([PrivDir, "foldl.zip"]),
  975: 
  976:     FooBin = <<"FOO">>,
  977:     BarBin = <<"BAR">>,
  978:     Files = [{"foo", FooBin}, {"bar", BarBin}],
  979:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, Files, [memory,{extra,[]}]),
  980:     ZipFun = fun(N, I, B, Acc) -> [{N, B(), I()} | Acc] end,
  981:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, Bin}),
  982:     [{"bar", BarBin, #file_info{}}, {"foo", FooBin, #file_info{}}] = FileSpec,
  983:     {ok, {File, Bin}} = zip:create(File, lists:reverse(FileSpec), [memory,{extra,[]}]),
  984:     {foo_bin, FooBin} =
  985: 	try
  986: 	    zip:foldl(fun("foo", _, B, _) -> throw(B()); (_, _, _, Acc) -> Acc end, [], {File, Bin})
  987: 	catch
  988: 	    throw:FooBin ->
  989: 		{foo_bin, FooBin}
  990: 	end,
  991:     ok = file:write_file(File, Bin),
  992:     {ok, FileSpec} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
  993: 
  994:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(fun() -> ok end, [], File),
  995:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], 42),
  996:     {error, einval} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], {File, 42}),
  997: 
  998:     ok = file:delete(File),
  999:     {error, enoent} = zip:foldl(ZipFun, [], File),
 1000: 
 1001:     ok.
 1002: 
 1003: fd_leak(Config) ->
 1004:     ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1005:     DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1006:     Name = filename:join(DataDir, "bad_file_header.zip"),
 1007:     BadExtract = fun() ->
 1008:                          {error,bad_file_header} = zip:extract(Name),
 1009:                          ok
 1010:                  end,
 1011:     do_fd_leak(BadExtract, 1),
 1012: 
 1013:     BadCreate = fun() ->
 1014:                         {error,enoent} = zip:zip("failed.zip",
 1015:                                                  ["none"]),
 1016:                         ok
 1017:                 end,
 1018:     do_fd_leak(BadCreate, 1),
 1019: 
 1020:     ok.
 1021: 
 1022: do_fd_leak(_Bad, 10000) ->
 1023:     ok;
 1024: do_fd_leak(Bad, N) ->
 1025:     try Bad() of
 1026:         ok ->
 1027:             do_fd_leak(Bad, N + 1)
 1028:     catch
 1029:         C:R:Stk ->
 1030:             io:format("Bad error after ~p attempts\n", [N]),
 1031:             erlang:raise(C, R, Stk)
 1032:     end.
 1033: 
 1034: unicode(Config) ->
 1035:     case file:native_name_encoding() of
 1036:         latin1 ->
 1037:             {comment, "Native name encoding is Latin-1; skipping all tests"};
 1038:         utf8 ->
 1039:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1040:             ok = file:set_cwd(get_value(priv_dir, Config)),
 1041:             test_file_comment(DataDir),
 1042:             test_archive_comment(DataDir),
 1043:             test_bad_comment(DataDir),
 1044:             test_latin1_archive(DataDir),
 1045:             case has_zip() of
 1046:                 false ->
 1047:                     {comment, "No zip program found; skipping some tests"};
 1048:                 true ->
 1049:                     case zip_is_unicode_aware() of
 1050:                         true ->
 1051:                             test_filename_compatibility(),
 1052:                             ok;
 1053:                         false ->
 1054:                             {comment, "Old zip program; skipping some tests"}
 1055:                     end
 1056:             end
 1057:     end.
 1058: 
 1059: test_filename_compatibility() ->
 1060:     FancyName = "üñíĉòdë한",
 1061:     Archive = "test.zip",
 1062: 
 1063:     {ok, Archive} = zip:zip(Archive, [{FancyName, <<"test">>}]),
 1064:     zipinfo_match(Archive, FancyName).
 1065: 
 1066: test_file_comment(DataDir) ->
 1067:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_file_comment.zip"),
 1068:     Comments = ["a", [246], [1024]],
 1069:     FileNames = [[C] ++ ".txt" || C <- [$a, 246, 1024]],
 1070:     [begin
 1071:          test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive),
 1072:          test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive)
 1073:      end ||
 1074:         Comment <- Comments, FileName <- FileNames],
 1075:     ok.
 1076: 
 1077: test_zip_file(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1078:     _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1079:     io:format("*** zip:zip(). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1080:               [FileName, Comment]),
 1081:     ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1082:     {ok, Archive} =
 1083:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1084:     zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "").
 1085: 
 1086: test_file_comment(FileName, Comment, Archive) ->
 1087:     case test_zip1() of
 1088:         false ->
 1089:             ok;
 1090:         true ->
 1091:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1092:             io:format("*** zip(1). Testing FileName ~ts, Comment ~ts\n",
 1093:                       [FileName, Comment]),
 1094:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1095:             R = os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -c " ++
 1096:                            Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1097:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [R]),
 1098:             zip_check(Archive, "", FileName, Comment)
 1099:     end.
 1100: 
 1101: test_archive_comment(DataDir) ->
 1102:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_archive_comment.zip"),
 1103:     Chars = [$a, 246, 1024],
 1104:     [test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) || Char <- Chars],
 1105:     ok.
 1106: 
 1107: test_archive_comment(Char, Archive) ->
 1108:     case test_zip1() of
 1109:         false ->
 1110:             ok;
 1111:         true ->
 1112:             _ = file:delete(Archive),
 1113:             FileName = "a.txt",
 1114:             Comment = [Char],
 1115:             io:format("*** Testing archive Comment ~ts\n", [Comment]),
 1116:             ok = file:write_file(FileName, ["anything"]),
 1117: 
 1118:             {ok, _} =
 1119:                 zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]),
 1120:             Res = os:cmd("zip -z " ++ Archive),
 1121:             io:format("os:cmd/1 returns ~lp\n", [Res]),
 1122:             true = lists:member(Char, Res),
 1123: 
 1124:             os:cmd("echo " ++ Comment ++ "| zip -z "++
 1125:                        Archive ++ " " ++ FileName),
 1126:             zip_check(Archive, Comment, FileName, "")
 1127:     end.
 1128: 
 1129: test_zip1() ->
 1130:     has_zip() andalso zip_is_unicode_aware().
 1131: 
 1132: has_zip() ->
 1133:     os:find_executable("zip") =/= false.
 1134: 
 1135: zip_is_unicode_aware() ->
 1136:     S = os:cmd("zip -v | grep 'UNICODE_SUPPORT'"),
 1137:     string:find(S, "UNICODE_SUPPORT") =/= nomatch.
 1138: 
 1139: zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, FileNameComment) ->
 1140:     {ok, CommentAndFiles} = zip:table(Archive),
 1141:     io:format("zip:table/1 returns\n  ~lp\n", [CommentAndFiles]),
 1142:     io:format("checking archive comment ~lp\n", [ArchiveComment]),
 1143:     [_] = [C || #zip_comment{comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1144:                 C =:= ArchiveComment],
 1145:     io:format("checking filename ~lp\n", [FileName]),
 1146:     io:format("and filename comment ~lp\n", [FileNameComment]),
 1147:     [_] = [F || #zip_file{name = F, comment = C} <- CommentAndFiles,
 1148:                 F =:= FileName, C =:= FileNameComment],
 1149:     {ok, FileList} = zip:unzip(Archive, [verbose]),
 1150:     io:format("zip:unzip/2 returns\n  ~lp\n", [FileList]),
 1151:     true = lists:member(FileName, FileList),
 1152:     ok.
 1153: 
 1154: test_bad_comment(DataDir) ->
 1155:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip_bad_comment.zip"),
 1156:     FileName = "a.txt",
 1157:     file:write_file(FileName, ["something"]),
 1158:     Comment = [9999999],
 1159:     {error,{bad_unicode,Comment}} =
 1160:         zip:zip(Archive, [FileName], [verbose, {comment, Comment}]).
 1161: 
 1162: test_latin1_archive(DataDir) ->
 1163:     Archive = filename:join(DataDir, "zip-latin1.zip"),
 1164:     FileName = [246] ++ ".txt",
 1165:     ArchiveComment = [246],
 1166:     zip_check(Archive, ArchiveComment, FileName, "").
 1167: 
 1168: test_zip_dir(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1169:     case {os:find_executable("unzip"), os:type()} of
 1170:         {UnzipPath, {unix,_}} when is_list(UnzipPath)->
 1171:             DataDir = get_value(data_dir, Config),
 1172:             Dir = filename:join([DataDir, "test-zip", "dir-1"]),
 1173:             TestZipOutputDir = filename:join(DataDir, "test-zip-output"),
 1174:             TestZipOutput = filename:join(TestZipOutputDir, "test.zip"),
 1175:             zip:create(TestZipOutput, [Dir]),
 1176:             run_command(UnzipPath, ["-o", TestZipOutput,  "-d", TestZipOutputDir]),
 1177:             {ok, FileContent} = file:read_file(filename:join([TestZipOutputDir, Dir, "file.txt"])),
 1178:             <<"OKOK\n">> = FileContent,
 1179:             ok;
 1180:         _ -> {skip, "Not Unix or unzip program not found"}
 1181:     end.
 1182: 
 1183: run_command(Command, Args) ->
 1184:     Port = erlang:open_port({spawn_executable, Command}, [{args, Args}, exit_status]),
 1185:     (fun Reciver() ->
 1186:              receive
 1187:                  {Port,{exit_status,_}} -> ok;
 1188:                  {Port, S} -> io:format("UNZIP: ~p~n", [S]),
 1189:                               Reciver()
 1190:              end
 1191:      end)().
 1192:     
 1193: explicit_file_info(_Config) ->
 1194:     Epoch = {{1980,1,1},{0,0,0}},
 1195:     FileInfo = #file_info{type=regular, size=0, mtime=Epoch},
 1196:     Files = [{"datetime", <<>>, FileInfo},
 1197:              {"seconds", <<>>, FileInfo#file_info{mtime=315532800}}],
 1198:     {ok, _} = zip:zip("", Files, [memory]),
 1199:     ok.
 1200: 
 1201: mode(Config) ->
 1202: 
 1203:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1204:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1205:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1206: 
 1207:     Executable = filename:join(PrivDir,"exec"),
 1208:     file:write_file(Executable, "aaa"),
 1209:     {ok, ExecFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1210:     ok = file:write_file_info(Executable, ExecFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1211: 
 1212:     Directory = filename:join(PrivDir,"dir"),
 1213:     ok = file:make_dir(Directory),
 1214:     {ok, DirFI } = file:read_file_info(Executable),
 1215:     ok = file:write_file_info(Directory, DirFI#file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400 }),
 1216: 
 1217:     ?assertMatch(
 1218:        {ok, Archive},
 1219:        zip(Config, Archive, "-r", ["dir","exec"], [{cwd, PrivDir},{extra,[extended_timestamp]}])),
 1220: 
 1221:     ?assertMatch(
 1222:        {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1223:              #zip_file{ name = "dir/", info = #file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400}},
 1224:              #zip_file{ name = "exec", info = #file_info{ mode = 8#111 bor 8#400}} ]},
 1225:        zip:list_dir(Archive)),
 1226: 
 1227:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1228:     ?assertMatch(
 1229:        {ok, ["dir/","exec"]}, unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1230: 
 1231:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1232:         true ->
 1233:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = ExecMode }} =
 1234:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"exec")),
 1235:             ?assertEqual(8#111 bor 8#400, ExecMode band 8#777),
 1236: 
 1237:             {ok,#file_info{ mode = DirMode }} =
 1238:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"dir")),
 1239:             ?assertEqual(8#111 bor 8#400, DirMode band 8#777);
 1240:         false ->
 1241:             %% emzip does not support mode
 1242:             ok
 1243:     end,
 1244: 
 1245:     ok.
 1246: 
 1247: %% Test that zip64 local and central headers are respected when unzipping.
 1248: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1249: %%  * compressed size
 1250: %%  * uncompressed size
 1251: %%  * relative offset
 1252: %%  * starting disk
 1253: %%
 1254: %% As we do not support using multiple disks, we do not test starting disks
 1255: zip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1256: 
 1257:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1258:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../archive.zip"),
 1259: 
 1260:     %% Check that ../../large.txt exists and is of correct size
 1261:     {ok, #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } } =
 1262:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(PrivDir, "../../large.txt")),
 1263: 
 1264:     %% We very carefully create an archive that should contain all
 1265:     %% different header combinations.
 1266:     %% - uncomp.txt: uncomp size > 4GB
 1267:     %% - uncomp.comp.zip: uncomp and comp size > 4GB
 1268:     %% - offset.txt: offset > 4GB
 1269:     %% - uncomp.offset.txt: uncomp size and offset > 4GB
 1270:     %% - uncomp.comp.offset.zip: uncomp and comp size and offset > 4GB
 1271:     %%
 1272:     %% The archive will be roughly 8 GBs large
 1273: 
 1274:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.txt")),
 1275:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.zip")),
 1276:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../medium.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "offset.txt")),
 1277:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.offset.txt")),
 1278:     ok = file:make_symlink("../../large.txt", filename:join(PrivDir, "uncomp.comp.offset.zip")),
 1279:     ?assertMatch(
 1280:        {ok, Archive},
 1281:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1",
 1282:            ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip","offset.txt",
 1283:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"],
 1284:            [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1285: 
 1286:     %% Check that list archive works
 1287:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1288:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.txt",
 1289:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1290:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.zip",
 1291:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1292:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1293:           #zip_file{ name = "offset.txt",
 1294:                      info = #file_info{ size = 4 bsl 20 } },
 1295:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.offset.txt",
 1296:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } },
 1297:           #zip_file{ name = "uncomp.comp.offset.zip",
 1298:                      comp_size = 1 bsl 32,
 1299:                      info = #file_info{ size = 1 bsl 32 } }
 1300:          ]} =
 1301:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1302:     ok.
 1303: 
 1304: unzip64_central_headers(Config) ->
 1305: 
 1306:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1307:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1308:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "../../archive.zip"),
 1309:     Large4GB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config),"large.txt"),
 1310:     Medium4MB = filename:join(get_value(priv_dir, Config), "medium.txt"),
 1311: 
 1312:     %% Test that extraction of each file works
 1313:     lists:map(
 1314:       fun F({Name, Compare}) ->
 1315:               ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1316:               ?assertMatch(
 1317:                  {ok, [Name]},
 1318:                  unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,[Name]}])),
 1319:               cmp(Compare, filename:join(ExtractDir,Name)),
 1320:               file:del_dir_r(ExtractDir);
 1321:           F(Name) ->
 1322:               F({Name, Large4GB})
 1323:       end, ["uncomp.txt","uncomp.comp.zip",{"offset.txt",Medium4MB},
 1324:             "uncomp.offset.txt","uncomp.comp.offset.zip"]),
 1325: 
 1326:     ok.
 1327: 
 1328: %% Test that zip64 end of central directory are respected when unzipping.
 1329: %% The fields in the header that can be 64-bit are:
 1330: %%   * total number of files > 2 bytes
 1331: %%   * size of central directory > 4 bytes (cannot test as it requires an archive with 8 million files)
 1332: %%   * offset of central directory > 4 bytes (implicitly tested when testing large relative location of header)
 1333: %%
 1334: %% Fields that we don't test as we don't support multiple disks
 1335: %%   * number of disk where end of central directory is > 2 bytes
 1336: %%   * number of disk to find central directory > 2 bytes
 1337: %%   * number central directory entries on this disk > 2 bytes
 1338: zip64_central_directory(Config) ->
 1339: 
 1340:     PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1341:     Dir = filename:join(PrivDir, "files"),
 1342:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1343: 
 1344:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1345: 
 1346:     %% To test when total number of files > 65535, we create an archive with 66000 entries
 1347:     ok = file:make_dir(Dir),
 1348:     lists:foreach(
 1349:       fun(I) ->
 1350:               ok = file:write_file(filename:join(Dir, integer_to_list(I)++".txt"),<<0:8>>)
 1351:       end, lists:seq(0, 65600)),
 1352:     ?assertMatch(
 1353:        {ok, Archive},
 1354:        zip(Config, Archive, "-1 -r", ["files"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1355: 
 1356:     {ok, Files} = zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1357:     ?assertEqual(65603, length(Files)),
 1358: 
 1359:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1360:     ?assertMatch(
 1361:        {ok, ["files/1.txt","files/65599.txt"]},
 1362:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{file_list,["files/1.txt",
 1363:                                                              "files/65599.txt"]}])),
 1364:     cmp(filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/1.txt"),
 1365:         filename:join(ExtractDir,"files/65599.txt")),
 1366: 
 1367:     ok.
 1368: 
 1369: %% Test basic timestamps, the atime and mtime should be the original
 1370: %% mtime of the file
 1371: basic_timestamp(Config) ->
 1372:     PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1373:     Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1374:     ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1375:     Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1376: 
 1377:     ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1378:     {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1379:         file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1380: 
 1381:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1382:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1383: 
 1384:     %% Create an archive without extended timestamps
 1385:     ?assertMatch(
 1386:        {ok, Archive},
 1387:        zip(Config, Archive, "-X", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}, {extra, []}])),
 1388: 
 1389:     {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1390:           #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime }} ]} =
 1391:         zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1392: 
 1393:     ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1394:     ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1395:     ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1396: 
 1397:     %% Timestamp in archive is when entry was added to archive
 1398:     %% Need to add 2 to ZMtime as the dos time in zip archives
 1399:     %% are in precise.
 1400:     ?assert(calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(Mtime) =<
 1401:                 calendar:datetime_to_gregorian_seconds(ZMtime) + 1),
 1402: 
 1403:     %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1404:     timer:sleep(1000),
 1405: 
 1406:     ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1407:     ?assertMatch(
 1408:        {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1409:        unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1410: 
 1411:     {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1412:                                mtime = UnZMtime,
 1413:                                ctime = UnZCtime
 1414:                              }} =
 1415:         file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt")),
 1416: 
 1417: 
 1418:     ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1419: 
 1420:     case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1421:         true ->
 1422:             ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1423:             ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1424: 
 1425:             ?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime);
 1426:         false ->
 1427:             %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1428:             ok
 1429:     end,
 1430: 
 1431:     ok.
 1432: 
 1433: %% Test extended timestamps, the atime and ctime in the archive are
 1434: %% the atime and ctime when the file is added to the archive.
 1435: extended_timestamp(Config) ->
 1436: 
 1437:     case os:cmd("zip -v | grep USE_EF_UT_TIME") of
 1438:         "" -> {skip, "zip does not support extended timestamps"};
 1439:         _ ->
 1440:             PrivDir =  get_value(pdir, Config),
 1441:             Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1442:             ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1443:             Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1444: 
 1445:             ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1446:             {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ mtime = Mtime }} =
 1447:                 file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1448: 
 1449:             %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1450:             timer:sleep(1000),
 1451: 
 1452:             ?assertMatch(
 1453:                {ok, Archive},
 1454:                zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1455: 
 1456:             %% list_dir only reads the central directory header and thus only
 1457:             %% the mtime will be correct here
 1458:             {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1459:                   #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ mtime = ZMtime}} ]} =
 1460:                 zip:list_dir(Archive),
 1461: 
 1462:             ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1463:             ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1464:             ct:log("zipinfo:~n~ts",[os:cmd("zipinfo -v "++Archive)]),
 1465: 
 1466:             ?assertEqual(Mtime, ZMtime),
 1467: 
 1468:             %% Sleep a bit to let the timestamp progress
 1469:             timer:sleep(1000),
 1470: 
 1471:             ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1472:             ?assertMatch(
 1473:                {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1474:                unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd,ExtractDir}])),
 1475: 
 1476:             {ok, UnzipFI = #file_info{ atime = UnZAtime,
 1477:                                        mtime = UnZMtime,
 1478:                                        ctime = UnZCtime
 1479:                                      }} =
 1480:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir, "testfile.txt")),
 1481: 
 1482:             ct:log("extract: ~p",[UnzipFI]),
 1483: 
 1484:             case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1485:                 true ->
 1486:                     ?assertEqual(ZMtime, UnZMtime),
 1487:                     ?assertEqual(UnZAtime, UnZMtime),
 1488: 
 1489:                     ?assert(UnZMtime < UnZCtime);
 1490:                 false ->
 1491:                     %% emzip does not support timestamps
 1492:                     ok
 1493:             end,
 1494: 
 1495:             ok
 1496:     end.
 1497: 
 1498: uid_gid(Config) ->
 1499: 
 1500:     case os:cmd("zip -v | grep STORE_UNIX_UIDs_GIDs") of
 1501:         "" -> {skip, "zip does not support uid/gids"};
 1502:         _ ->
 1503: 
 1504:             PrivDir = get_value(pdir, Config),
 1505:             ExtractDir = filename:join(PrivDir, "extract"),
 1506:             Archive = filename:join(PrivDir, "archive.zip"),
 1507:             Testfile = filename:join(PrivDir, "testfile.txt"),
 1508: 
 1509:             ok = file:write_file(Testfile, "abc"),
 1510:             {ok, OndiskFI = #file_info{ gid = GID, uid = UID }} =
 1511:                 file:read_file_info(Testfile),
 1512: 
 1513:             ?assertMatch(
 1514:                {ok, Archive},
 1515:                zip(Config, Archive, "", ["testfile.txt"], [{cwd, PrivDir}])),
 1516: 
 1517:             {ok, [#zip_comment{},
 1518:                   #zip_file{ info = ZipFI = #file_info{ gid = ZGID, uid = ZUID }} ]} =
 1519:                 zip:list_dir(Archive,[{extra, [uid_gid]}]),
 1520: 
 1521:             ct:log("on disk: ~p",[OndiskFI]),
 1522:             ct:log("in zip : ~p",[ZipFI]),
 1523: 
 1524:             ?assertEqual(UID, ZUID),
 1525:             ?assertEqual(GID, ZGID),
 1526: 
 1527:             ok = file:make_dir(ExtractDir),
 1528:             ?assertMatch(
 1529:                {ok, ["testfile.txt"]},
 1530:                unzip(Config, Archive, [{cwd, ExtractDir},{extra,[uid_gid]}])),
 1531: 
 1532:             {ok,#file_info{ gid = ExZGID, uid = ExZUID }} =
 1533:                 file:read_file_info(filename:join(ExtractDir,"testfile.txt")),
 1534: 
 1535:             case get_value(unzip, Config) =/= unemzip of
 1536:                 true ->
 1537:                     ?assertEqual(UID, ExZUID),
 1538:                     ?assertEqual(GID, ExZGID);
 1539:                 _ ->
 1540:                     %% emzip does not support uid_gid
 1541:                     ok
 1542:             end,
 1543: 
 1544:             ok
 1545:     end.
 1546: 
 1547: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1548: %%% Generic zip interface
 1549: %%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
 1550: zip(Config, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1551:     zip(get_value(zip, Config),
 1552:         Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts);
 1553: zip(zip, Archive, ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1554:     cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1555:         "zip "++ZipOpts++" "++Archive++" "++lists:join($ ,Filelist)),
 1556:     {ok, Archive};
 1557: zip(ezip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1558:     ct:log("Creating zip:zip(~p,~n~p,~n~p)",[Archive, Filelist, Opts]),
 1559:     zip:zip(Archive, Filelist, Opts);
 1560: zip(emzip, Archive, _ZipOpts, Filelist, Opts) ->
 1561:     ct:log("Creating emzip ~ts",[Archive]),
 1562:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts),
 1563:     {Files,_Cache} =
 1564:         lists:mapfoldl(
 1565:           fun F(Fn, Cache) ->
 1566:                   AbsFn = filename:join(Cwd, Fn),
 1567:                   {ok, Fi} = file:read_file_info(AbsFn),
 1568:                   {SubDirFiles, NewCache} =
 1569:                       if Fi#file_info.type == directory ->
 1570:                               {ok, Files} = file:list_dir(AbsFn),
 1571:                               lists:mapfoldl(F, Cache#{ Fn => <<>> },
 1572:                                              [filename:join(Fn, DirFn) || DirFn <- Files]);
 1573:                          Fi#file_info.type == regular ->
 1574:                               %% For this not to use a huge amount of memory we re-use
 1575:                               %% the binary for files that are links to the same file.
 1576:                               %% This cuts memory usage from ~16GB to ~4GB.
 1577:                               {[],
 1578:                                case file:read_link_all(AbsFn) of
 1579:                                   {ok, LinkFn} ->
 1580:                                       case maps:get(LinkFn, Cache, undefined) of
 1581:                                           undefined ->
 1582:                                               {ok, Data} = file:read_file(AbsFn),
 1583:                                               Cache#{ LinkFn => Data, Fn => Data };
 1584:                                           Data ->
 1585:                                               Cache#{ Fn => Data }
 1586:                                       end;
 1587:                                   {error, _} ->
 1588:                                       {ok, Data} = file:read_file(AbsFn),
 1589:                                       Cache#{ Fn => Data }
 1590:                               end}
 1591:                       end,
 1592:                   {[{Fn, maps:get(Fn, NewCache), Fi}|SubDirFiles], NewCache}
 1593:           end,  #{}, Filelist),
 1594:     zip:zip(Archive, lists:flatten(Files), proplists:delete(cwd,Opts)).
 1595: 
 1596: 
 1597: unzip(Config, Archive, Opts) when is_list(Config) ->
 1598:     unzip(get_value(unzip, Config), Archive, Opts);
 1599: unzip(unzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1600:     UidGid = [" -X " || lists:member(uid_gid, get_value(extra, Opts, []))],
 1601:     Files = lists:join($ , get_value(file_list, Opts, [])),
 1602:     Res = cmd("cd "++get_value(cwd, Opts)++" && "
 1603:               "unzip "++UidGid++" "++Archive++" "++Files),
 1604:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1605:            lists:flatmap(
 1606:              fun(Ln) ->
 1607:                      case re:run(Ln, ~B'\s+[a-z]+: ([^\s]+)', [{capture,all_but_first,list},unicode]) of
 1608:                          nomatch -> [];
 1609:                          {match,Match} -> Match
 1610:                      end
 1611:              end,string:split(Res,"\n",all)))};
 1612: unzip(unezip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1613:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1614:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, Opts),
 1615:     {ok, lists:sort([F -- Cwd || F <- Files])};
 1616: unzip(unemzip, Archive, Opts) ->
 1617:     Cwd = get_value(cwd, Opts) ++ "/",
 1618:     {ok, Files} = zip:unzip(Archive, [memory | Opts]),
 1619:     {ok, lists:sort(
 1620:            [begin
 1621:                 case lists:last(F) of
 1622:                     $/ ->
 1623:                         filelib:ensure_path(F);
 1624:                     _ ->
 1625:                         filelib:ensure_dir(F),
 1626:                         file:write_file(F, B)
 1627:                 end,
 1628:                 F -- Cwd
 1629:             end || {F, B} <- Files])}.
 1630: 
 1631: cmp(Source, Target) ->
 1632:     "" = cmd("cmp --silent "++Source++" "++Target++~s' || echo "files are different"').
 1633: 
 1634: cmd(Cmd) ->
 1635:     Res = os:cmd(Cmd),
 1636:     ct:log("Cmd: ~ts~nRes: ~ts~n",[Cmd, Res]),
 1637:     Res.
 1638: 
 1639: disc_free(Path) ->
 1640:     Data = disksup:get_disk_data(),
 1641: 
 1642:     %% What partitions could Data be mounted on?
 1643:     Partitions =
 1644:         [D || {P, _Tot, _Perc}=D <- Data,
 1645:          lists:prefix(filename:nativename(P), filename:nativename(Path))],
 1646: 
 1647:     %% Sorting in descending order places the partition with the most specific
 1648:     %% path first.
 1649:     case lists:sort(fun erlang:'>='/2, Partitions) of
 1650:         [{_,Tot, Perc} | _] -> round(Tot * (1-(Perc/100)));
 1651:         [] -> error
 1652:     end.
 1653: 
 1654: memsize() ->
 1655:     case proplists:get_value(available_memory, memsup:get_system_memory_data()) of
 1656:         undefined ->
 1657:             {Tot,_Used,_}  = memsup:get_memory_data(),
 1658:             Tot;
 1659:         Available ->
 1660:             Available
 1661:     end.
